message:
No community is immune.
"Modern-day slavery operates in the shadows of Long Island’s well-performing school districts and world-renowned beach communities, with victims often too scared to seek help." #HumanTrafficking

data.description: Slavery impacted every community of Long Island until New York State formally abolished the practice in 1827, historians say. But a different form of slavery exists on Long Island today — often under the radar.
data.title: Long Island's Human Trafficking Crisis Thrives in Shadows
